definition: to smoke/to fumigate/to assail the nostrils/to perfume
fragrance/warm/to educate/variant of 熏[xun1]/to smoke/to fumigate
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130

sentences.english: The next day, she spooned some of the bacon grease into a pan and fried eggs in it.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，她用勺子拿一些熏肉油脂放到锅里来煎鸡蛋。

sentences.english: At the diner I have bacon and eggs and another beer.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭我吃了熏肉和鸡蛋，喝了啤酒。

sentences.english: Discard the bacon rind and cut each rasher in half.
sentences.chinese: 去掉熏肉的外皮，再把每一片熏肉切成两半。

sentences.english: Discard the bacon rind and cut each rasher in half.
sentences.chinese: 去掉熏肉的外皮，再把每一片熏肉切成两半。

sentences.english: Note, eating bacon will not give you the virus.
sentences.chinese: 但请注意，吃熏肉不会传染上这种病毒。

sentences.english: This unique alarm clock will start cooking bacon in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 这款独特的闹钟早上会开始烹饪熏肉。

sentences.english: In neat little rows I tacked the hides on the smokehouse wall.
sentences.chinese: 我把那些皮子整齐地钉在了熏肉间的墙上。

sentences.english: The metaphor comes from the idea of a project to make breakfast of bacon and eggs.
sentences.chinese: 比喻的想法来自于一个项目，使早餐的熏肉和蛋。

sentences.english: We had bacon and eggs for breakfast.
Bacon and egg are the popular American breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 熏肉和蛋是普遍的美国早餐。

sentences.english: Other hidden sources include cured meats, frozen or boxed foods, and fast foods.
sentences.chinese: 其他的隐性来源包括熏肉，冷冻或盒装食品，快餐。

sentences.english: I guess I'll have some bacon and some toast, please.
sentences.chinese: 我想我要一些熏肉和吐司面包。

sentences.english: Herbs and bacon are often added too for extra flavor.
sentences.chinese: 此外还可以加入植物香料和熏肉来增添特殊风味。

sentences.english: Cook bacon until done, but not brown.
Enjoy this wine with sharp cheeses or cured meats such as Parma Prosciutto .
sentences.chinese: 非常适合搭配重口味乳酪或腌熏肉类，如帕玛火腿等。
